title: UK box office report, October 18-20: can Maleficent break the Angelina Jolie curse?
text:
The winner: Joker

For the third week in a row, Joker sits at the top of the UK box office chart – this time with takings of £5.49m. Having fallen by a slim 22 per cent on its second weekend of release, the dark origin story now experiences a bigger drop: down 44 per cent. However, that’s still the gentlest decline of any film in the current UK top 20. UK total for Joker after 17 days is a very sturdy £40.3m, and the film looks on course to crack £50m.

Not many films achieve three weekends at £5m-plus in the UK. So far this year, only Toy Story 4, The Lion King and now Joker have managed to do so. The year’s biggest hit Avengers: Endgame failed to do so – because it reached its audience at such...
